proof:
Step 1:
Theorem: Known facts
Premises : start
Conclusions: F on DG, G on FH, AK || BI, AK || CJ, ∠HEB, E on DG, ∠IEH, G on EH, ∠IEH, ∠HEI, pi * ((3 * y) / 180) = ∠JFG, F on EH, ∠BEH, 3.14 = pi, BI || CJ, pi * ((5 * y - 4) / 180) = ∠FEB, ∠AGD, G on AK, ∠KGD, ∠BEH, ∠DGA, ∠HEB, pi * ((13 + 2 * x) / 180) = ∠KGH

Step 2:
Theorem: Alternate Interior Angle Theorem
Premises : AK || BI
Conclusions: ∠BEG = ∠KGE, ∠AGE = ∠IEG

Step 3:
Theorem: Corresponding Angle Theorem
Premises : AK || BI
Conclusions: ∠HEB = ∠HGA, ∠HEI = ∠HGK

Step 4:
Theorem: Alternate Interior Angle Theorem
Premises : AK || CJ
Conclusions: ∠FGA = ∠GFJ, ∠AGF = ∠JFG

Step 5:
Theorem: Straight Angle
Premises : ∠IEH, ∠HEB
Conclusions: pi = ∠HEB + ∠IEH

Step 6:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : G on EH, ∠IEH
Conclusions: ∠IEG = ∠IEH

Step 7:
Theorem: Reverse Angle Definition
Premises : ∠IEH
Conclusions: ∠IEH = 2 * pi - ∠HEI

Step 8:
Theorem: Reverse Angle Definition
Premises : ∠HEI
Conclusions: ∠HEI = 2 * pi - ∠IEH

Step 9:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : F on EH, ∠HEB
Conclusions: ∠FEB = ∠HEB

Step 10:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : F on EH, ∠BEH
Conclusions: ∠BEF = ∠BEH

Step 11:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : G on EH, ∠BEH
Conclusions: ∠BEG = ∠BEH

Step 12:
Theorem: Alternate Interior Angle Theorem
Premises : BI || CJ
Conclusions: ∠BEF = ∠JFE

Step 13:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : F on DG, ∠AGD
Conclusions: ∠AGD = ∠AGF

Step 14:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : E on DG, ∠AGD
Conclusions: ∠AGD = ∠AGE

Step 15:
Theorem: Vertical Angle Theorem
Premises : G on AK, G on FH
Conclusions: ∠AGF = ∠KGH

Step 16:
Theorem: Vertical Angle Theorem
Premises : G on EH, G on AK
Conclusions: ∠EGA = ∠HGK

Step 17:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : F on DG, ∠KGD
Conclusions: ∠KGD = ∠KGF

Step 18:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : E on DG, ∠KGD
Conclusions: ∠KGD = ∠KGE

Step 19:
Theorem: Reverse Angle Definition
Premises : ∠BEH
Conclusions: ∠BEH = 2 * pi - ∠HEB

Step 20:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : E on DG, ∠DGA
Conclusions: ∠DGA = ∠EGA

Step 21:
Theorem: Same Angle
Premises : F on DG, ∠DGA
Conclusions: ∠DGA = ∠FGA

Step 22:
Theorem: Reverse Angle Definition
Premises : ∠HEB
Conclusions: ∠HEB = 2 * pi - ∠BEH

Step 23:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠AGF = ∠JFG, pi * ((3 * y) / 180) = ∠JFG
Conclusions: pi * ((3 * y) / 180) = ∠AGF

Step 24:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : 3.14 = pi, pi = ∠HEB + ∠IEH
Conclusions: 3.14 = ∠HEB + ∠IEH

Step 25:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠IEG = ∠IEH, ∠AGE = ∠IEG
Conclusions: ∠AGE = ∠IEH

Step 26:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠FEB = ∠HEB, ∠HEB = ∠HGA, pi * ((5 * y - 4) / 180) = ∠FEB
Conclusions: pi * ((5 * y - 4) / 180) = ∠HGA

Step 27:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠BEG = ∠BEH, ∠BEG = ∠KGE
Conclusions: ∠BEH = ∠KGE

Step 28:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠DGA = ∠FGA, ∠FGA = ∠GFJ
Conclusions: ∠DGA = ∠GFJ

Step 29:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠AGD = ∠AGF, pi * ((3 * y) / 180) = ∠AGF
Conclusions: pi * ((3 * y) / 180) = ∠AGD

Step 30:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠AGF = ∠KGH, pi * ((13 + 2 * x) / 180) = ∠KGH, pi * ((3 * y) / 180) = ∠AGF
Conclusions: pi * ((3 * y) / 180) = pi * ((13 + 2 * x) / 180)

Step 31:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : pi * ((5 * y - 4) / 180) = ∠HGA, ∠HEB = ∠HGA
Conclusions: pi * ((5 * y - 4) / 180) = ∠HEB

Step 32:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠BEF = ∠BEH, ∠BEH = ∠KGE, ∠BEF = ∠JFE
Conclusions: ∠JFE = ∠KGE

Step 33:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠DGA = ∠EGA, ∠EGA = ∠HGK, ∠DGA = ∠GFJ
Conclusions: ∠GFJ = ∠HGK

Step 34:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : pi * ((3 * y) / 180) = ∠AGD, ∠AGD = ∠AGE, ∠AGE = ∠IEH
Conclusions: pi * ((3 * y) / 180) = ∠IEH

Step 35:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : pi * ((5 * y - 4) / 180) = ∠HEB, ∠HEB = 2 * pi - ∠BEH
Conclusions: pi * ((5 * y - 4) / 180) = 2 * pi - ∠BEH

Step 36:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠JFE = ∠KGE, ∠KGD = ∠KGE, ∠KGD = ∠KGF
Conclusions: ∠JFE = ∠KGF

Step 37:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠HEI = ∠HGK, ∠GFJ = ∠HGK
Conclusions: ∠GFJ = ∠HEI

Step 38:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : pi * ((3 * y) / 180) = ∠IEH, ∠IEH = 2 * pi - ∠HEI
Conclusions: pi * ((3 * y) / 180) = 2 * pi - ∠HEI

Step 39:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠JFE = ∠KGE, ∠JFE = ∠KGF
Conclusions: ∠KGE = ∠KGF

Step 40:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠GFJ = ∠HEI, ∠HEI = 2 * pi - ∠IEH
Conclusions: ∠GFJ = 2 * pi - ∠IEH

Step 41:
Theorem: Substitution
Premises : pi * ((3 * y) / 180) = 2 * pi - ∠HEI, 3.14 = pi, ∠GFJ = ∠HEI
Conclusions: 3.14 * ((3 * y) / 180) = 2 * 3.14 - ∠GFJ

Step 42:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠KGE = ∠KGF, ∠BEH = ∠KGE
Conclusions: ∠BEH = ∠KGF

Step 43:
Theorem: Substitution
Premises : 3.14 = pi, ∠GFJ = 2 * pi - ∠IEH
Conclusions: ∠GFJ = 2 * 3.14 - ∠IEH

Step 44:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : ∠BEH = ∠KGF, ∠BEH = 2 * pi - ∠HEB
Conclusions: ∠KGF = 2 * pi - ∠HEB

Step 45:
Theorem: Substitution
Premises : ∠BEH = ∠KGF, 3.14 = pi, pi * ((5 * y - 4) / 180) = 2 * pi - ∠BEH
Conclusions: 3.14 * ((5 * y - 4) / 180) = 2 * 3.14 - ∠KGF

Step 46:
Theorem: Solve Linear Equation System
Premises : ∠KGF = 2 * pi - ∠HEB, 3.14 * ((5 * y - 4) / 180) = 2 * 3.14 - ∠KGF, ∠GFJ = 2 * 3.14 - ∠IEH, ∠GFJ = 2 * pi - ∠IEH, 3.14 * ((3 * y) / 180) = 2 * 3.14 - ∠GFJ, 3.14 = ∠HEB + ∠IEH
Conclusions: 1.2 = ∠IEH

Step 47:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : pi * ((3 * y) / 180) = ∠IEH, 1.2 = ∠IEH
Conclusions: 1.2 = pi * ((3 * y) / 180)

Step 48:
Theorem: Transtivity of Equivalence
Premises : pi * ((3 * y) / 180) = pi * ((13 + 2 * x) / 180), 1.2 = pi * ((3 * y) / 180)
Conclusions: 1.2 = pi * ((13 + 2 * x) / 180)

Step 49:
Theorem: Substitution
Premises : 3.14 = pi, 1.2 = pi * ((13 + 2 * x) / 180)
Conclusions: 1.2 = 3.14 * ((13 + 2 * x) / 180)

Step 50:
Theorem: Solve Linear Equation System
Premises : 1.2 = 3.14 * ((13 + 2 * x) / 180)
Conclusions: 28 = x
logic_fomrs_refined: Equals(MeasureOf(Angle(F, E, B)), Mul(pi, Div(Sub(Mul(5.0, y), 4.0), 180.0)))
Equals(MeasureOf(Angle(J, F, G)), Mul(pi, Div(Mul(3.0, y), 180.0)))
Equals(MeasureOf(Angle(K, G, H)), Mul(pi, Div(Add(Mul(2.0, x), 13.0), 180.0)))
